article:
This is a list of independent countries and inhabited dependent
territoriesâbased on the ISO standard ISO 3166-1âby population. Also given in
percent is each country's population compared to the population of the world,
which according to the United States Census Bureau population clock is estimated
at / 10^9 round 3}}}} billion.

According to a separate estimate by the United Nations, world population
exceeded 7 billion in October 2011.

[http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2011/10/31/7-billion-
people-is-a-serious-challenge/UPI-73301320046200 "7 billion people is a 'serious
challenge'"]. UPI, 31 October 2011. Retrieved 2011-11-09. Areas that form
integral parts of sovereign states, such as the countries of the United Kingdom,
are counted as part of the sovereign states concerned. Not included are other
entities, such as the European Union, The European Union is a [[sui
generis]] supranational union whose sovereign members delegate to it by treaty
certain powers that are often exercised by sovereign states. Its combined
population has been estimated at 503,491,975 on January 1, 2012, it would be
ranked 3rd if it were included in the list, and it has * 100 round 2}}% of the
world's population â see  that are not sovereign states, and
dependent territories that do not have permanent populations, such as various
countries' claims to Antarctica.

Figures used in this chart are based on the most up to date estimate or
projections [http://www.economist.com/node/18651512 China's Population: The
Most Surprising Demographic Crisis], The Economist, 2013. by the national
census authority where available, and are usually rounded off. Where updated
national data are not available, figures are based on the 2013 estimates by the
Population Division of the United Nations Department of Economic and Social
Affairs. Because the compiled figures are not collected at
the same time in every country, or at the same level of accuracy, the resulting
numerical comparisons may create misleading conclusions. Furthermore, the
addition of figures from all countries may not equal the world total.

For a graphical version of this list, see list of countries by population
(graphical). See also List of sovereign states and dependent territories by
population density and the list of regional organizations by population.
